node.text:
From a very early age, African-American civil rights icon and #UnitedNations leader, Ralph Bunche understood the pain and peril of racism.

Yet Bunche turned those experiences into a catalyst for change on the international stage, pursuing a legendary career as one of the most senior diplomatic officials of his time. 

From walking side-by-side with Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., to working for peace as a UN mediator in Palestine, watch and learn more about the Nobel Prize Laureate. 

#FightRacism

node.title: Hero for Justice on the World's Stage

node.text:
"Because of climate change we are seeing even more intense storms, rising sea levels and many deaths. But we don’t have to accept this – we can act - and we must act as a matter of justice."

Environmentalist Sunita Narain explains why it's important that all of us #ActNow to achieve the goals of the #ParisAgreement. 

"Every country, rich or poor, is exposed to extreme weather. We need to build better and more resilient infrastructure – from electricity grids to roads, bridges and buildings. All these approaches are set out in the Paris Climate Agreement – adopted by nearly 200 countries. We can do it – we must do it – and we must act quickly."

From recycling to using less energy and water to opting for public transport, each and every one of us can take little steps in our everyday lives that can have a big impact. Tell us in the comments what you are doing to protect our planet.

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
"We don’t have to choose between using energy and protecting the planet."

@unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains the role sustainable energy plays in building a better future for all. 
 
"Imagine a world where every job is based on clean, renewable energy – and where wind and solar are even more abundant. And where energy is affordable and reliable – and available to everyone. This might sound like a fantasy – but it’s achievable and we know how to get there."

The #ParisAgreement on the climate emergency is our roadmap for moving to a low-carbon economy and achieving a sustainable future. Since this international #ClimateAction treaty opened for signature 5 years ago, almost 200 countries have signed on to tackle the climate crisis together to limit global warming to protect people and planet.

 #GlobalGoals #ActNow

node.text:
Cities are major contributors to the climate crisis, but also an important hub for #ClimateAction.

@UNEP Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee explains what a green future for cities could look like & how the #ParisAgreement can help us get there.

node.text: Meet @unep Young Champion of the Earth Nzambi Matee. She's a Kenyan engineer taking #ClimateAction and helping to #BeatPlasticPollution by recycling plastic waste into building materials.

node.text:
"My warmest wishes to everyone celebrating #EidAlFitr," #UnitedNations Secretary-General @antonioguterres said on Wednesday.

"I was delighted to mark the end of Ramadan with Asia El-Sayeed Ali, a Yemeni health worker helping malnourished children and mothers in a @worldfoodprogramme-supported nutrition clinic.

Asia personifies core values of Ramadan: compassion and empathy. Her resilience in the face of the devastating conflict in Yemen, as well as her life-saving work in support of people in desperate need have moved me greatly.

As #Ramadan comes to an end, let us continue drawing inspiration from its many lessons of solidarity that are celebrated during this Holy Month."

Regram: @antonioguterres

node.text:
Regram: @antonioguterres

Young people are the most affected by the climate decisions taken today. Their ideas, voices and actions are crucial to deliver meaningful and ambitious #ClimateAction for all.

@pcopaloma and @mahery_loha are two inspiring climate activists who exemplify the leadership and commitment of young people worldwide to address the most challenging problems we face today.

I'm grateful for our discussion and their insights on how to achieve the meaningful participation of youth, women and indigenous peoples as we tackle the climate crisis.

#ActNow #GlobalGoals

node.text:
@unep Goodwill Ambassador @aidanrgallagher describes how the #ParisAgreement can help us create a world free from the threats of the climate crisis. 

"This is personal for me," he explains. "I don’t want to choke on the air I breathe, or see wildfires burning out of control. So let’s keep working together. And you too can protect what is left and repair what has been damaged."

On Thursday's #EarthDay, @antonioguterres will be joining the U.S. Leaders’ Summit on Climate to reiterate his call for urgent #ClimateAction. 

"The Paris Agreement is our pact with our children, grandchildren & the whole human family," said the Secretary-General. 

"The climate crisis is the race of our lifetimes. We must go much further, and much faster."

#GenerationRestoration #ForNature

node.text: On Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight, @europeanspaceagency astronaut @thom_astro became the newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador. He will use his voice and unique perspective from space to advocate for #ClimateAction and to help reduce hunger.

node.title: French astronaut Thomas Pesquet becomes newest @fao Goodwill Ambassador

node.text:
All children have the right to a happy and healthy childhood, free from discrimination and full of love and acceptance. And acceptance begins at home. Every child should grow up in safe, loving and nurturing environment.

No child should suffer because of who they are. All children deserve protection and equal rights. Let's see kids the way they see themselves.

On Wednesday's International Transgender Day of Visibility, join @unaidsglobal in calling for the rights of transgender children to be protected.

#TransDayOfVisibility #SeeMeAsIAm

node.text:
Six years since the start of the conflict, millions of Yemenis are in need of humanitarian assistance. Over four million are displaced within the country. 

Our colleagues from UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugees Agency, are in #Yemen providing aid, but they cannot do it alone. 

Please click the link in the @refugees' bio to help. 

#YemenCantWait

node.text:
Maya (@ghazalmia) fled Damascus, #Syria at age 16 and overcame numerous barriers to become the world’s first female Syrian refugee pilot. 

Check out her inspiring story!

#WithRefugees

node.title: Meet Maya Ghazal, the newest @refugees Goodwill Ambassador

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 07, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people sitting, people standing and text that says 'AWAKE AT NIGHT'.

node.text:
Meet award-winning disability activist @eddiendopu from South Africa. 

“When I could no longer pursue the dream of being an artist because my hands became too weak to hold a pencil, I needed to dream a new dream, and I realized that that is, in itself, a gift, to be able to pivot and change direction and ask yourself, what else? I still have my spirit. I still have my mind, and I still have a deep desire and yearning for an extraordinary life. And I still want to be of service to humanity and the world.” 
 
Diagnosed at age two with spinal muscular atrophy, a rare degenerative condition, and given only five years to live, Eddie is now 30 and has dedicated his life to ensure that the voices of those at greatest risk of being left behind are amplified and heard worldwide. In 2019, he was appointed by UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres as one of 17 #UnitedNations advocates for the Sustainable Development Goals. 

In an inspiring conversation on our podcaste 'Awake At Night', he talks to UN Global Communications chief @melissarfleming about the difficult daily challenges he has faced throughout his life, especially during the #COVID19 pandemic. He also shares his big dream: to be the first physically disabled person in outer space and to address the UN from there. 

Regram: @melissarfleming: | 📸: UN Photo; Humanity and Inclusion (2019) 

#GlobalGoals

node.text:
People are enveloped in hazy air as they walk through a public square in Skopje, North Macedonia, one of the most polluted cities in Europe. ⁣
⁣
“You can smell and taste the pollution the moment you walk out of the door. Even on a clear day, there’s this poisonous tang in the air. You know it’s damaging your health and your children’s health, but you feel helpless to do anything about it," explains Jasminka Markovska, a mother of three in Skopje.⁣
⁣
Tuesday is the International Day of Clean Air for blue skies. ⁣
⁠⁣
Worldwide, nine out of ten people breathe polluted air, which kills nearly seven million people every year, according to @WHO. Air pollution is an environmental risk to human health and despite being a preventable problem, has detrimental impacts on climate, biodiversity and ecosystems and more.⁣
⁣
Everyone can take #ClimateAction to help #BeatAirPollution, including by walking or taking public transport instead of driving. ⁣
⁣
Regram: @UNDP I 📸: UNDP /@sumayaagha⁠⁣
⁣
#GlobalGoals #CleanAirDay

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 06, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child, standing and indoor.

node.text:
Meet seven-year-old Polina from #Ukraine. 

A grenade killed her grandmother, her uncle and a neighbour. Polina and her parents received serious shrapnel wounds.

“She had a cardiac arrest,” recalls her mother, Svitlana. "She learned to walk again. She suffered deep wounds on both legs. But she remained alive – this is the most important.”

As families deal with the trauma and tragedy caused by conflict, UNICEF is calling on all sides to urgently step up efforts to protect children.

Regram: @unicef | 📷: UNICEF/UN0504361/UN0504359/Filippov

#NotATarget

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 06, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child, standing and indoor.
Photo by United Nations on September 06, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, child, people sitting, people standing and indoor.
Photo by United Nations on September 06, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, people standing and indoor.

node.text:
Lorena and her family fled #Honduras after a street gang tried to forcibly recruit her younger brother.

When they reported the crime to police, the gang threatened to kill them. “We’re stuck," she explains." We can’t go back home, and we can’t go forward. We are adrift.”

Lorena lives with two of her children in a makeshift shelter in #Mexico.

“It’s traumatic. It’s desperate. I don’t know this place. I don’t have family here.”

Thousands of asylum seekers like Lorena are living in limbo in shelters and makeshift camps across northern Mexico, unable to go forward, and terrified of returning home.

UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugee Agency, has helped more than 10,000 refugees start over in safer parts of Mexico in formal jobs with full benefits including healthcare.

Regram: @refugees | 📷: UNHCR / Tim Gaynor

#Withrefugees

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 05, 2021. May be a closeup of 1 person and child.

node.text:
Meet Elisa, a 9-year-old student from #Rwanda whose school receives meals from the @worldfoodprogramme (WFP). 

“Before we started getting food at school, I could spend a whole day without food,” he explains. “I could come to school, read books, and go back home hungry. Sometimes I wouldn’t find any food at home either.”

A WFP home-grown school feeding programme in Rwanda supports 107 schools in the country’s most vulnerable districts. Elisa’s is one such school, attended by some 800 students.

Vulnerable families can feel pressures to pull children like Elisa out of school to help with work at home. Daily school meals provide a strong incentive to keep them in the classroom.

Regram: @wfpusa 

#ZeroHunger #GlobalGoals

node.text:
This picture, entitled "Waterspout at Sea", was taken in #Croatia and is the September cover photo from the 2021 World Meteorological Organization calendar. 

Over the past 50 years, weather, climate and water extremes have killed 115 people and cost USD $202 million on average per day.

The climate crisis has caused the number of disasters and economic losses to increase, but thanks to improved early warnings and disaster management, the number of deaths has decreased.

Warning systems help us adapt to climate change and build a more resilient future. 

Regram: @wmo_omm | 📸: Sandro Puncet

#ClimateAction

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations in Mexico. May be a closeup of 1 person.

node.text:
#Throwback to 1975 when Mother Teresa of Calcutta made a statement at the World Conference on Women in #Mexico. 

For over 45 years, Mother Teresa worked for the poor, sick, orphaned and dying. She received the @nobelprize_org for Peace in 1979 for her charitable work.

Her selflessness helped inspire the creation of Sunday's International #CharityDay - the anniversary of her passing. 

Show your support by thanking all those who are doing their part to make the world a better place, especially amid the challenges posed by the #COVID19 pandemic. Tell us in the comments who you’d like to thank!

📷: UN Photo / B Lane

#GlobalGoals

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 04, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child, standing and indoor.

node.text:
12-year-old Ahmed sits among bomb-blasted rubble that once was his classroom in #Yemen.

What should be a joyful place of learning, and a sanctuary for children, was yet another target of a brutal act of war.

UNICEF is calling for governments to commit to the Safe Schools Declaration. Places of education, teachers and students are #NotATarget and must always be protected.

Regram: @unicef | 📸: UNICEF/UN0459558/Marish

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by United Nations on September 03, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, child and outdoors.

node.text:
28-year-old Triffonie gently shelters her child from the sun at a site for internally displaced people in #Burundi. 

Triffonie's family was forced to flee from their home due to terrible floods, and her life was turned upside down. “I had a roof over my head, as a farmer, I could support myself and my family but in one night I lost everything. I now live in an emergency shelter not knowing where my next meal is going to come from,” the young mother explains. 

Since 2018, 445 disasters in Burundi have affected nearly 270,000 people, 100,000 of whom were displaced. 

The #UnitedNations Migration Organization (IOM) works with partners to provide humanitarian assistance to those most in need, by providing water and sanitation, shelter, psychosocial support, and more.

Regram: @unmigration I 📷 IOM / Armel Nkunzimana 

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
Beekeepers Menglieva Meriban and Bakthiyar Menligiev from #Uzbekistan proudly display one of their honeycomb frames.

The couple has been involved in bee farming for almost a decade. Their two children love the fresh honey from the farm and Meriban enjoys watching how the bees work and live as one family. "They are not very different from us in that regard," she laughs.

The family is among the many bee farmers from the Aral Sea region who have faced severe challenges after part of the lake dried up. But thanks to training and support from the #UnitedNations Development Programme (UNDP), the family was able to expand their business and increase their hives from four to 18.

The climate crisis, disappearing habitats, fewer varieties of wildflowers as well as increased diseases, pollution and pesticides are all affecting the future of bees. 

Regram: @undp  I 📸: @undpuzbekistan; @pnudgt 

#ClimateAction #GlobalGoals

node.text:
Nafeesa, a refugee, receives a #COVID19 vaccine at a vaccination centre in #India. ⁣
⁣
UNHCR, the #UnitedNations Refugee Agency, calls on States to expedite the roll-out of vaccination campaigns and remove barriers that limit access to vaccines for the world’s 82.4 million forcibly displaced people.⁣
⁣
Fair and equal access to vaccines is urgently needed, because no one will be safe until everyone is safe. #OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. ⁣
⁣
Regram: @refugees | 📷: UNHCR / Asif Shazhad⁣
⁣
#WithRefugees #GlobalGoals

node.text:
#TBT to 1952 when the General Assembly Hall was completed at #UnitedNations Headquarters in #NYC.⁣
⁣
The GA Hall was designed by eleven architects and is the largest room at UNHQ with a seating capacity of about 1,900 people. ⁣
⁣
The central dome adds height to the front of the Hall, and in the centre is a small opening where natural light enters the room. The wooden battens are made of mahogany and covered with a copper alloy.⁣
⁣
Later this month, world leaders will come together for the 76th session of the #UNGA, where they will seek solutions to some of the biggest problems facing humanity.⁣
⁣
📷: UN Photo Archives⁣
⁣
#ThrowbackThursday
